CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: To investigate the morphology of the polymer / PCBM blend film , atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed , and the result is shown in Figure 6. In Figure 6a , microphase separation occurred between the polymer and PC71BM , while the polymer formed a small fibril - type domain at a 1 : 1 PQCDTB / PC71BM ratio. As shown in Figure 6c , the fibril domain or microphase separation was clearer when measured at a 1 × 1 μm 2 size. It appears that this type of fibril domain occurred because PQCDTB formed effective π-π stacking based on outstanding crystallinity. 31 As shown in Figure 6b , in contrast , when the PQCDTB / PC71BM ratio was 1 : 2 , the polymers were assembled , and a large domain was formed. As a result , a relatively large - size phase separation took place. As shown in Figure 6d , the large domain or the large - size phase separation was clearer when measured at a 1 × 1 μm 2 size. The large - phase separation exhibits a low photocurrent by reducing the charge separation and increasing the exciton diffusion length and the recombination of electric charges. 32 Therefore , at a 1 : 2 polymer / PC71BM ratio , a large phase separation occurs between the polymer and the PC71BM. As a result , a low photocurrent would occur ; this is comparable to the 1 : 1 ratio. The same results were confirmed for the current device using the data in Table 3. Similar results were observed between PQCDTB and PC61BM as well. When the PCZDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 4 , a smooth morphology was detected , and no fibril domain was observed , just like the PQCDTB , because the self - organization of PCZDTB is lower than that of PQCDTB. 9 In this study , PQCDTB has been successfully synthesized through the Suzuki coupling reaction by introducing planar quinacridone unit and a broad - absorption benzothiadiazole unit. PQCDTB had a high molecular weight and good thermal stability. Because of the appropriate HOMO and LUMO energy levels , an effective balance was produced. According to the X-ray diffraction measurement , a broad diffraction peak was observed at approximately 24.0 ° . In terms of the π-π stacking distance ( d π ) , a significantly shorter distance ( 3.7 Å ) was observed. These values were similar to the results of the thiophene and thiophenefused aromatic system polymers. When the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 1 , the highest efficiency was detected , and V OC , J SC , FF , and PCE were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , 55.8% , and 2.5% , respectively. When the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 1 , the polymer formed a fibril - type domain and microphase separation occurred between the polymer and PC71BM. Because of selforganization , PQCDTB showed a higher FF compared with PCZDTB.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCBM (Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-[6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester))
2. PC71BM ([6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester)
3. PCZDTB (Planar quinacridone unit and broad-absorption benzothiadiazole unit based polymer)
4. PQCDTB (Synthesized PQCDTB polymer)
5. Thiophene and thiophenefused aromatic system polymers

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCBM |
| PC71BM |
| PCZDTB |
| PQCDTB |
| Thiophene and thiophenefused aromatic system polymers |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCBM (Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-[6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester)) |
| PC71BM ([6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester) |
| PQCDTB (Planar quinacridone unit and broad-absorption benzothiadiazole unit based polymer, synthesized as PQCDTB) |

These are the material names mentioned in the paragraph. The other entities such as "polymer," "fibril domain," "large domain," "phase separation," and "self-organization" are not material names but rather descriptions or phenomena related to the materials.

Paragraph: To investigate the morphology of the polymer / PCBM blend film , atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed , and the result is shown in Figure 6. In Figure 6a , microphase separation occurred between the polymer and PC71BM , while the polymer formed a small fibril - type domain at a 1 : 1 PQCDTB / PC71BM ratio. As shown in Figure 6c , the fibril domain or microphase separation was clearer when measured at a 1 × 1 μm 2 size. It appears that this type of fibril domain occurred because PQCDTB formed effective π-π stacking based on outstanding crystallinity. 31 As shown in Figure 6b , in contrast , when the PQCDTB / PC71BM ratio was 1 : 2 , the polymers were assembled , and a large domain was formed. As a result , a relatively large - size phase separation took place. As shown in Figure 6d , the large domain or the large - size phase separation was clearer when measured at a 1 × 1 μm 2 size. The large - phase separation exhibits a low photocurrent by reducing the charge separation and increasing the exciton diffusion length and the recombination of electric charges. 32 Therefore , at a 1 : 2 polymer / PC71BM ratio , a large phase separation occurs between the polymer and the PC71BM. As a result , a low photocurrent would occur ; this is comparable to the 1 : 1 ratio. The same results were confirmed for the current device using the data in Table 3. Similar results were observed between PQCDTB and PC61BM as well. When the PCZDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 4 , a smooth morphology was detected , and no fibril domain was observed , just like the PQCDTB , because the self - organization of PCZDTB is lower than that of PQCDTB. 9 In this study , PQCDTB has been successfully synthesized through the Suzuki coupling reaction by introducing planar quinacridone unit and a broad - absorption benzothiadiazole unit. PQCDTB had a high molecular weight and good thermal stability. Because of the appropriate HOMO and LUMO energy levels , an effective balance was produced. According to the X-ray diffraction measurement , a broad diffraction peak was observed at approximately 24.0 ° . In terms of the π-π stacking distance ( d π ) , a significantly shorter distance ( 3.7 Å ) was observed. These values were similar to the results of the thiophene and thiophenefused aromatic system polymers. When the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 1 , the highest efficiency was detected , and V OC , J SC , FF , and PCE were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , 55.8% , and 2.5% , respectively. When the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 1 , the polymer formed a fibril - type domain and microphase separation occurred between the polymer and PC71BM. Because of selforganization , PQCDTB showed a higher FF compared with PCZDTB.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: To investigate the morphology of the polymer / PCBM blend film , atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed , and the result is shown in Figure 6. In Figure 6a , microphase separation occurred between the polymer and PC71BM , while the polymer formed a small fibril - type domain at a 1 : 1 PQCDTB / PC71BM ratio. As shown in Figure 6c , the fibril domain or microphase separation was clearer when measured at a 1 × 1 μm 2 size. It appears that this type of fibril domain occurred because PQCDTB formed effective π-π stacking based on outstanding crystallinity. 31 As shown in Figure 6b , in contrast , when the PQCDTB / PC71BM ratio was 1 : 2 , the polymers were assembled , and a large domain was formed. As a result , a relatively large - size phase separation took place. As shown in Figure 6d , the large domain or the large - size phase separation was clearer when measured at a 1 × 1 μm 2 size. The large - phase separation exhibits a low photocurrent by reducing the charge separation and increasing the exciton diffusion length and the recombination of electric charges. 32 Therefore , at a 1 : 2 polymer / PC71BM ratio , a large phase separation occurs between the polymer and the PC71BM. As a result , a low photocurrent would occur ; this is comparable to the 1 : 1 ratio. The same results were confirmed for the current device using the data in Table 3. Similar results were observed between PQCDTB and PC61BM as well. When the PCZDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 4 , a smooth morphology was detected , and no fibril domain was observed , just like the PQCDTB , because the self - organization of PCZDTB is lower than that of PQCDTB. 9 In this study , PQCDTB has been successfully synthesized through the Suzuki coupling reaction by introducing planar quinacridone unit and a broad - absorption benzothiadiazole unit. PQCDTB had a high molecular weight and good thermal stability. Because of the appropriate HOMO and LUMO energy levels , an effective balance was produced. According to the X-ray diffraction measurement , a broad diffraction peak was observed at approximately 24.0 ° . In terms of the π-π stacking distance ( d π ) , a significantly shorter distance ( 3.7 Å ) was observed. These values were similar to the results of the thiophene and thiophenefused aromatic system polymers. When the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 1 , the highest efficiency was detected , and V OC , J SC , FF , and PCE were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , 55.8% , and 2.5% , respectively. When the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 1 , the polymer formed a fibril - type domain and microphase separation occurred between the polymer and PC71BM. Because of selforganization , PQCDTB showed a higher FF compared with PCZDTB.

Let's think step by step.

1. In Figure 6a, microphase separation occurred between the polymer and PC71BM with a size of 1 × 1 μm².
   Property Value: Microphase separation size: 1 × 1 μm²

2. The fibril domain or microphase separation was clearer when measured at a 1 × 1 μm² size.
   Property Value: Microphase separation size for measurement: 1 × 1 μm²

3. The fibril domain or microphase separation exhibits a low photocurrent.
   Property Value: Photocurrent: low

4. At a 1 : 2 polymer / PC71BM ratio, a large phase separation occurs.
   Property Value: Phase separation type: large

5. The large domain or the large-size phase separation was clearer when measured at a 1 × 1 μm² size.
   Property Value: Large domain size for measurement: 1 × 1 μm²

6. The large phase separation exhibits a low photocurrent.
   Property Value: Photocurrent: low

7. The highest efficiency was detected when the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 1.
   Property Value: Voltage at the open circuit (VOC): 0.79 V
   Property Value: Current density (JSC): 5.6 mA cm⁻²
   Property Value: Fill factor (FF): 55.8%
   Property Value: Power conversion efficiency (PCE): 2.5%

8. The π-π stacking distance (d π) for PQCDTB is 3.7 Å.
   Property Value: π-π stacking distance: 3.7 Å

9. The broad diffraction peak was observed at approximately 24.0 °.
   Property Value: Broad diffraction peak position: approximately 24.0 °

10. PQCDTB has a high molecular weight.
    Property Value: Molecular weight: high

11. PQCDTB has good thermal stability.
    Property Value: Thermal stability: good

12. The appropriate HOMO and LUMO energy levels for PQCDTB.
    Property Value: HOMO energy level: N/A
    Property Value: LUMO energy level: N/A

13. The X-ray diffraction measurement observed a broad diffraction peak at approximately 24.0 °.
    Property Value: Broad diffraction peak position (XRD): approximately 24.0 °

14. The self-organization of PCZDTB is lower than that of PQCDTB.
    Property Value: Self-organization of PCZDTB: lower than PQCDTB

15. PQCDTB was synthesized with a high molecular weight and good thermal stability.
    Property Value: Molecular weight (synthesized PQCDTB): high
    Property Value: Thermal stability (synthesized PQCDTB): good

16. PQCDTB had appropriate HOMO and LUMO energy levels.
    Property Value: HOMO energy level (PQCDTB): N/A
    Property Value: LUMO energy level (PQCDTB): N/A

17. The broad diffraction peak was observed at approximately 24.0 ° for PQCDTB.
    Property Value: Broad diffraction peak position (PQCDTB): approximately 24.0 °

18. The π-π stacking distance (d π) for PQCDTB is similar to the results of thiophene and thiophenefused aromatic system polymers.
    Property Value: π-π stacking distance (PQCDTB): similar to thiophene and thiophenefused aromatic system polymers

19. The highest efficiency was detected when the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 1, and the polymer formed a fibril-type domain and microphase separation occurred between the polymer and PC71BM.
    Property Value: Phase separation type: fibril-type domain and microphase separation
    Property Value: Fill factor (FF): higher for PQCDTB compared to PCZDTB.
